Gagal Urus BPJS, Pemerintah Disebut Langgar Hak Asasi Manusia
07 Nov 2019, 20:07 by Fitratun KOmariah


Gagal Urus BPJS, Pemerintah Disebut Langgar Hak Asasi Manusia

KBRN, Jakarta: Politisi muda Partai Keadilan Sejahtera (PKS) Muhammad Kholid menilai gagalnya pemerintah mengelola Badan Penyelenggara Jaminan Sosial (BPJS) Kesehatan sama artinya pemerintah telah melanggar hak asasi manusia."Kalau bicara BPJS, negara harus bertanggung jawab terhadap sistem jaminan sosial nasional ini. Ini basic premier, bukan sekunder, core of the core. Jika tidak mewujudkan negara bisa dikatakan gagal. Tugas negara itu bukan bagi-bagi sertifikat," kata Khalid diskusi publik PKS Muda Talks bertajuk "BPJS Naik, Rakyat (Makin) Tercekik" di Gedung DPP PKS, Kamis (7/11/2019).Menurut Kholid, jika ada orang yang sedang sakit, harus segera ditangani secepat mungkin tanpa harus bertanya apakah dia memiliki asuransi atau tidak."Orang sakit nggak bisa diperiksa gara-gara tidak ada asuransi. Ini melanggar hak asasi manusia. Terlihat pemerintah membuat policy ini asal-asalan, tidak melihat dampak sistemiknya," imbuh Khalid. "Dengan naikknya iuran BPJS akan semakin banyak yang menunggak. Potensi penunggakan semakin tinggi," sambungnya. Senada dengan Khalid, Anggota Komisi IX DPR RI Fraksi Partai Keadilan Sejahtera, Kurniasih Mufidayati mengatakan ketidaksetujuannya terhadap kenaikan iuran BPJS terutama pada iuran kelas III. “Kita sudah sampaikan tidak setuju kenaikan iuran BPJS khususnya untuk kelas III, karena memberatkan masyarakat. Rakyat jangan jadi korban defisit BPJS,” tegas Mufidayati saat agenda Rapat Dengar Pendapat Komisi IX DPR RI di Jakarta (6/11/2019).

Failure to Manage BPJS, Government Called to Violate Human Rights
Nov 7 2019, 20:07 by Fitratun KOmariah


Failure to Manage BPJS, Government Called to Violate Human Rights

KBRN, Jakarta: Young politician from the Prosperous Justice Party (PKS) Muhammad Kholid assesses that the failure of the government to manage the Social Security Administering Agency (BPJS) means that the government has violated human rights. "It's basic premiere, not secondary, core of the core. If it doesn't realize the country it can be said to be failing. The country's task is not to divide certificates," Khalid said. PKP DPP Building, Thursday (11/07/2019). According to Kholid, if someone is sick, they must be treated as soon as possible without asking if he has insurance or not. "The sick cannot be checked because there is no insurance. "This violates human rights. The government seems to make this policy carelessly, not seeing the systemic impact," Khalid added. "With the increase in BPJS fees, there will be more arrears. The potential for arrears is higher," he continued. In line with Khalid, Member of the House of Representatives Commission IX of the Prosperous Justice Party Faction, Kurniasih Mufidayati said his disapproval of the increase in BPJS fees, especially in class III fees. "We have said that we do not agree with the increase in BPJS fees, especially for class III, because it is burdensome to the community. People should not be victims of the BPJS deficit, "said Mufidayati during the agenda of the DPR IX Commission Hearing Meeting in Jakarta (6/11/2019).
